property.name: jar.extra.jars
property.value: xercesImpl-2.5.0.jar avalon-framework-cvs-20020806.jar xml-apis.jar xalan-2.5.2.jar batik.jar fop.jar kunststoff.jar skinlf.jar wraplf.jar jep-2.24.jar jdom.jar MRJ141Stubs.jar djep-2.24.jar RngPack-1.1a.jar tracerapi.jar

target.name: scripts
target.echo: REM PCGEN.BAT REM ================== REM REM This script should only be used if you have more then 256MB of RAM and if you REM don't mind committing at least 128MB of these to PCGEN. REM The value after -Xmx is the maximum amount of memory that PCGen will be allowed to use. REM It defaults to 64MB. REM The value after -Xms is the starting memory, using both then to speed up PCGEN. REM To load all sources takes more than the default 64MB. java -Xms128m -Xmx256m -jar ${jar.bin.file}

REM PCGEN_LOW_MEM.BAT REM Uncomment the following line and comment out the last line REM if you have Out of Memory problems. The value after -Xmx is the REM maximum amount of memory that PCGen will be allowed to use. REM It defaults to 64MB. REM The value after -Xms is the starting memory, using both then to speed up PCGEN. REM java -Xms128m -Xmx256m -jar ${jar.bin.file} REM To load all sources takes more than the default 64MB. java -Xmx96m -jar ${jar.bin.file}

#!/bin/sh cd `dirname $$0`
pcgendir="$$HOME/.pcgen"
if [ ! -d "$$pcgendir" ] then mkdir "$$pcgendir" || exit 2 fi
if [ "x$$BROWSER" = x ] then case "$$WINDOWMANAGER" in *kde ) BROWSER=kde-open ;; *gdm ) BROWSER=gnome-open ;; * ) BROWSER=netscape ;; esac fi
# To load all sources takes more than the default 64MB. javaargs="-Xms128m -Xmx256m" pcgenargs="" whosearg=java
while [ "x$$1" != x ] do case "$$1" in -h ) cat <<EOM usage: $$0 [java-options] [-- pcgen-options] For java options, try 'java -h' and 'java -X -h'. Useful java property defines: -DBROWSER=/path/to/browser -Dpcgen.filter=/path/to/filter.ini -Dpcgen.options=/path/to/options.ini This script recognizes the BROWSER environment variable. EOM exit 0 ;; -- ) whosearg=pcgen ;; * ) if [ "$$whosearg" = java ] then javaargs="$$javaargs $$1" else pcgenargs="$$pcgenargs $$1" fi ;; esac shift done
# PCGen related properties: # # pcgen.filter - the full path to the file name containing the filter settings # pcgen.options - the full path to the file name containing the options # # Both of these properties are optional. Default behaviour is to get the # files from the "user.dir" directory. # # Additional properties: # -DBROWSER="$BROWSER" # -Dpcgen.filter=/path/to/filter.ini # -Dpcgen.options=/path/to/options.ini
exec java -DBROWSER="$$BROWSER" $$javaargs -jar ./${jar.bin.file} $$pcgenargs

target.name: rebuild
target.description: Clean, refresh from CVS, and build the jar file.

target.name: all
target.depends: clean, build, test, emma.report, javaNcss, docs, deploy

target.name: complete
target.depends: clean, fetch-devel, build, fetch-data, fetch-docs, fetch-sheets, test, emma.report, javaNcss, docs, deploy
target.description: Everything including developer refresh from CVS.

target.name: build
target.depends: emma, compile, instrument, jar, jar-plugin, build-extra

target.name: build13
target.echo: Run pcgendev.bat (or pcgendev.sh) to run build.

target.name: build-optimize
target.description: Do an [incremental] build (compile, jar) with optimization on.
target.echo: Run pcgendev.bat (or pcgendev.sh) to run build.

target.name: deploy
target.description: Ship the jars, wars, whatever to the execution system.

target.name: gzip
target.description: Ship the jars, wars, whatever to the execution system.

target.name: real-clean
target.description: Clean everything back to initial checkout

target.name: fetch-devel
target.description: Get the latest source from the CVS tree as a developer; this gives read-write access to the sources.

target.name: fetch-anon
target.description: Get the latest source anonymously from the CVS tree; this gives read-only access to the sources.

target.name: fetch-data
target.description: Get the latest data files anonymously from the PCGen:DM CVS tree; this gives read-only access to the data files.

target.name: fetch-docs
target.description: Get the latest doc files anonymously from the PCGenDocs CVS tree; this gives read-only access to the doc files.

target.name: fetch-sheets
target.description: Get the latest output sheet files anonymously from the PCGenDocs CVS tree; this gives read-only access to the sheet files.

target.name: instrument
target.description: instruments all of the class files

target.name: test
target.description: Run test suite (include lib/junit.jar and xmlunit1.0.jar in CLASSPATH)

echo.message: One or more JUnit tests failed.
